decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to assemble the Cephalid Illusionist and Shuko combo to mill your entire library and then use cards like Dread Return and Thassa's Oracle to win the game on the spot. The deck includes protection spells like Force of Will and Brainstorm to ensure the combo goes off smoothly, as well as disruptive cards like Thoughtseize and Cabal Therapy to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck also includes cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Step Through to facilitate finding key combo pieces.

This deck focuses on assembling powerful artifacts, such as Coveted Jewel and Paradox Engine, to generate mana and card advantage. It aims to quickly ramp up its resources and disrupt the opponent's game plan using cards like Force of Will and Sink into Stupor. The key strategy is to use cards like Transmute Artifact and Copy Artifact to find and duplicate key pieces of the combo, allowing the player to generate a significant advantage and potentially win the game quickly.

The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and prevent opponents from executing their game plan. It also utilizes powerful artifacts and equipment to enhance its creatures and apply additional pressure. The inclusion of Yorion as a companion allows for strong synergy with the deck's flicker effects, generating additional value and advantage. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies while applying consistent pressure on the board through a combination of aggressive creatures and powerful artifacts.

This deck focuses on utilizing aggressive creatures to disrupt opponents' strategies while gaining value through controlling aspects of the game. It includes powerful removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Thoughtseize to deal with threats, along with versatile creatures like Skyclave Apparition and Stoneforge Mystic to apply pressure and generate advantage. The inclusion of Aether Vial allows for creatures to be deployed at instant speed, while the use of Karakas provides additional disruption against opposing legendary creatures. Overall, the deck aims to establish a proactive game plan while disrupting key elements of the opponent's strategy.

The deck aims to quickly build up a large Death's Shadow while disrupting opponents with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Force of Will. It also utilizes other cheap threats like Murktide Regent and Cecil, Dark Knight to apply pressure on opponents. The deck includes a good amount of cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to dig for answers and threats efficiently. The mana base is optimized for maximum efficiency with fetchlands and Wasteland to disrupt opponents' mana base. The deck is built to be fast, disruptive, and resilient against various strategies in the Legacy format.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and tempo plays like Daze and Brazen Borrower. The deck utilizes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and combines disruptive elements with powerful threats like Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf to pressure the opponent. The mana base consists of fetch lands and Wasteland to ensure consistency and disruption. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and additional disruption, while Brainstorm and Mishra's Bauble help set up draws and manipulate the top of the deck for optimal plays.

This Dimir Tempo deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's game plan with a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and Sheoldred's Edict, while also maintaining tempo with cards like Daze and Brainstorm. The deck aims to control the board with removal spells like Fatal Push and creatures like Baleful Strix, while also utilizing powerful threats like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Murktide Regent to close out the game quickly. The mana base is streamlined to ensure consistent access to all the necessary colors to execute its game plan efficiently.

The deck focuses on using the card Doomsday to set up a winning combination with cards like Thassa's Oracle and Lion's Eye Diamond. It includes various cantrips and disruption spells to protect the combo and find the necessary pieces quickly. The deck aims to quickly assemble its win condition while disrupting opponents' strategies with cards like Thoughtseize and Force of Will. The mana base includes a variety of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana sources while also including utility lands like Cavern of Souls and Undercity Sewers.

This deck focuses on assembling the Doomsday combo, utilizing cards like Dark Ritual, Lotus Petal, and Personal Tutor to set up a winning Thassa's Oracle and/or Quantum Riddler win condition. The deck includes disruption in the form of Force of Will, Duress, and Thoughtseize to protect the combo. Additionally, the deck includes some cantrips like Brainstorm and Ponder to help find the pieces needed to execute the combo. The mana base is designed to support the deck's requirements, with a mix of fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent mana access.

This Doomsday Combo deck focuses on setting up a win condition by stacking the top 5 cards of the library in a specific order using Doomsday. Thassa's Oracle is the primary win condition, with Quantum Riddler as a backup. The deck includes a mix of cantrips and control elements to dig for key pieces and protect the combo. Lion's Eye Diamond is used for additional mana acceleration. The deck aims to execute the combo quickly and efficiently while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to apply early pressure with efficient creatures like Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with Chalice of the Void. The deck also utilizes mana acceleration with cards like Lotus Petal and Grim Monolith to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures ahead of schedule. The mana base includes lands like Cavern of Souls and Eye of Ugin to make sure Eldrazi spells can be cast reliably. Additionally, the deck includes removal spells like Kozilek's Command to deal with opponent's threats.

This Eldrazi Aggro deck focuses on quickly deploying powerful Eldrazi creatures to overwhelm the opponent and disrupt their game plan. By using cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Glaring Fleshraker to disrupt the opponent's hand and removal spells like Kozilek's Command to control the board, this deck aims to pressure the opponent and close out the game quickly. With a mix of mana acceleration and disruptive elements, this deck aims to utilize its aggressive creatures to control the game and secure a victory.

The main strategy of this Grixis Control deck is to disrupt your opponent's game plan while controlling the board with removal spells and counterspells. The deck aims to control the game by utilizing powerful spells like Thoughtseize, Brainstorm, Force of Will, and Snapcaster Mage. It also includes cards like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student for card advantage and to generate value. The mana base includes a variety of lands to ensure consistent access to all three colors in the Grixis wedge.

This deck focuses on assembling various artifact pieces to generate mana and control the board, while utilizing Mystic Forge to consistently dig through the deck and find key pieces to win the game. The deck uses powerful artifacts like Urza's Saga, Grim Monolith, and Karn, the Great Creator to power out threats and disrupt the opponent's game plan. With the ability to generate large amounts of mana and consistently draw cards with Mystic Forge, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats and control the game until victory is achieved.

This deck focuses on disrupting your opponent's game plan while applying pressure with efficient and versatile creatures like Delver of Secrets and Brazen Borrower. It utilizes a strong counter package with cards like Force of Will, Daze, and Flusterstorm to protect its threats and control the board. The deck also has card filtering and card advantage engines in the form of Brainstorm, Ponder, and Preordain to help find key pieces and maintain tempo. The mana base is streamlined with fetch lands and Wasteland to ensure consistent access to needed colors while disrupting the opponent's resources.

The main concept of this Legacy Goblins deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive tribe. By ramping up mana with cards like Simian Spirit Guide and Chrome Mox, the deck can quickly deploy powerful Goblin threats like Goblin Rabblemaster and Muxus, Goblin Grandee. The inclusion of disruption cards like Chalice of the Void and Stingscourger helps control the game and protect the Goblin army. With a mix of efficient creatures and mana acceleration, this deck aims to swarm the opponent and win through sheer aggression.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly deploy evasive creatures like Ornithopter and Ninjas like Yuriko, the Tiger's Shadow to deal consistent damage to the opponent while also generating incremental advantage with cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Retrofitter Foundry. The deck also includes disruption in the form of countermagic like Force of Will, removal spells like Fatal Push and pressure from cards like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares. The deck aims to apply pressure early and maintain tempo advantage throughout the game while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to cast powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using cards like Show and Tell and Omniscience. It also utilizes counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its combo pieces, while using cards like Brainstorm and Ponder for card selection. Veil of Summer provides protection against disruption, while Cunning Wish allows for additional utility options. Overall, the key strategy is to cheat big creatures into play and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats.

The deck relies on playing cards like Show and Tell and Omniscience to cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. It also utilizes cards like Cunning Wish and Veil of Summer for protection and disruption. The goal is to quickly assemble the combo pieces and overwhelm the opponent with huge, game-ending threats. The deck has a strong ramp component with cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb to quickly get to the necessary mana to cast its big spells.

The deck focuses on cheating out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Atraxa, Grand Unifier using cards like Show and Tell and Sneak Attack. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats early in the game, while using counterspells like Force of Will and disruptive spells like Flusterstorm to protect the combo. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student helps with card draw and selection, while Omniscience allows for even more explosive plays. The deck aims to quickly establish board control and pressure the opponent before they can react effectively.

The deck focuses on controlling the board with a mix of counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures like Phelia and Quantum Riddler. Stoneforge Mystic helps tutor for equipment like Kaldra Compleat and Meteor Sword to dominate the battlefield. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and deck manipulation, while Dress Down can disrupt opponents' strategies. The deck also includes a strong land destruction package with Wasteland and Karakas. Overall, the deck aims to control the game and slowly grind out advantages to secure victory.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by using a combination of powerful control cards like Force of Will, Brainstorm, Swords to Plowshares, and Daze. Stoneforge Mystic is used to search for key equipment cards such as Batterskull, Kaldra Compleat, and Meteor Sword to give your creatures an edge in combat. Murktide Regent provides a big threat on the board, while Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Quantum Riddler offer both protection and disruption. The deck also includes a mana base with access to powerful lands like Karakas and Wasteland to disrupt your opponent's strategy.

This UR Aggro Legacy deck focuses on using efficient threats like Delver of Secrets and Dragon's Rage Channeler to apply pressure on the opponent quickly. It also utilizes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Daze to protect its threats and control the game. The deck aims to be proactive, utilizing cards like Mishra's Bauble and Brainstorm to consistently draw into the right cards while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Lightning Bolt and Wasteland. It aims to win the game quickly and decisively through a combination of aggression and disruption.
